title: Is it good when a jungler focuses a specific lane?
body: When the other two lanes are either slightly winning or slightly losing, not on any particularly extreme condition, is it alright for a jungler to focus a single lane to completely shut down the enemy, and only gank the other two lanes after, or when they start to need it more?

replies.body: Depends on the scenario, some champions do better with an advantage (like Yasuo for example) and others do fine from behind (like Vayne) it's all about knowing which lane you should be shutting down/getting ahead, and ganking at the right times.
There is no set way to jungle, all pathing ganking and map control are extremely circumstantial, but timing everything is pretty important i.e. Summs, buffs, dragons, ults, and wards
